intro: Belonophora wernhamii, commonly known as the Wernham's bellflower, is a species of flowering plant in the Campanulaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa, particularly in Namibia and South Africa. The plant is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Belonophora wernhamii is often found in open grasslands and is adapted to arid or semi-arid climates.
